# Data

A typical workflow begins with using the Leontief decomposition in the **decompr** package.

```r
# load the package
library(decompr)
```

We will use the example data set

```r
data(leather)
```

and apply the leontief decomposition and post multiply with exports

```
l <- decomp(inter,
            final,
            countries,
            industries,
            out)
```

# Analysis

We can now analyse the **l** object with the **gvc package**

```r
library(gvc)
```

For instance, using the **new revealed comparative advantage**.

```r
nrca(l)
```

and **importing to export**

```r
i2e(l)
```

finally, using **exporting to re-export**

```r
e2r(l)
```
